Subjective: Headache x 2 months, worsening. Right side worse, sometimes everywhere. Nausea when headache worst, no vomiting. Glare in vision, no flashes. Prefers dark room. Headache comes, lasts a few days, then subsides. Family history of migraines and cluster headaches. No serious causes in family. No smoking, occasional alcohol.
Objective: BP 120/80, pulse 50. Neurological exam: Cranial nerves intact, fingertip-nose test good, arm/leg strength good, Romberg's normal, walking straight line slightly off.
Assessment: Suspected migraine. Does not fit cluster headache.
Plan: 1. Read about migraines on thuisarts.nl. 2. Take paracetamol 4x2 as soon as symptoms start, add ibuprofen if needed. 3. Keep a headache diary to identify patterns/worsening factors. 4. Follow-up in 4 weeks, sooner if worse or changes.
